title: Introductory Computer Science Course Lab Design: Structured Problem-Solving and Collaborative Learning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming concepts and logical thinking skills
context.additional_context: Effective maintenance system implementation through continuous educational research design in closed laboratory settings, emphasizing interdisciplinary approaches between social sciences and computer science

learning_goals: Students can diagnose foundational computer science problems with over 80% accuracy using a structured problem-solving framework.
Learners can successfully complete complex coding tasks collaboratively with team members in a cooperative learning environment at least three times.
Learners can propose strategies to improve learning effectiveness by over 20% through analysis of data collected during laboratory activities.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
